Dispute_Type: Immigration application processing and regulatory transition
Legal_Issue: Whether an incomplete application can preserve an applicant's position under a previous regulatory scheme
Evidence_Assessment: Initial submission lacked proof of fee payment
Burden_of_Proof: On the applicant to demonstrate procedural fairness or legitimate expectation
Legal_Rule: Paragraph 10(1)(d) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations requires payment of fees for completeness
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness, as applicable to administrative interpretation
Procedural_Issue: Application returned due to incompleteness; resubmission under new online system
Grounds_for_Claim: Allegation that the applicantâ€™s rights under the prior regulatory regime were preserved despite incomplete submission
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim failed; incomplete application did not 'lock in' status under old rules
Review_Standard: Interpretation of regulatory requirements and procedural fairness
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No legitimate expectation established for continued application of old process
Key_Evidence_Considered: Presence or absence of fee payment confirmation in initial submission
Legal_Framework: Canadian Experience Class Program, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Applicant_Challenge: Seeking recognition of application under previous regulatory framework
Defendant_Response: Application was properly returned as incomplete; new procedures lawfully applied
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of decision to not accept incomplete application under prior rules
Outcome: Application dismissed; question certified on whether incomplete application can 'lock in' status
Remedy_Sought: Recognition of application under previous regulatory scheme
Legal_Provision: Paragraph 10(1)(d), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Authority: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration matters
Claimant_Status: Applicant under Canadian Experience Class Program
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to meet completeness requirements for application
Applicable_Process: Permanent residence application under Canadian Experience Class
Governing_Rule: Paragraph 10(1)(d), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
